story.iWant: to measure the actual conversation style used by the agent
story.soThat: style can be compared against targets and improved over time

context.applies: Every call - measures how the agent actually communicated
assumptions: Style is measurable from agent utterances
Style should adapt to caller personality (targets from ADAPT specs)
Multiple style dimensions combine to create overall communication approach

acceptanceCriteria.title: Warmth Measurement
acceptanceCriteria.then: Warmth level is scored based on language choices and tone markers

acceptanceCriteria.title: Formality Measurement
acceptanceCriteria.then: Formality level is scored based on vocabulary and structure

acceptanceCriteria.title: Directness Measurement
acceptanceCriteria.then: Directness is scored based on communication clarity and hedging

acceptanceCriteria.title: Pacing Measurement
acceptanceCriteria.then: Pacing is scored based on response length and information density

acceptanceCriteria.title: Exploration vs Structure Measurement
acceptanceCriteria.then: Exploration-structure balance is scored based on topic handling

parameters.name: Warmth (Actual)
parameters.description: Measured warmth level in agent's communication - emotional tone, friendliness, care

scoringAnchors.example: Oh, that's wonderful to hear! I'm so glad things are going well for you. Tell me more about how that made you feel!
scoringAnchors.rationale: High enthusiasm, emotional engagement, personal interest

scoringAnchors.example: That sounds really positive! I'm happy to hear you're making progress. How has this affected your week?
Good to know. That's a positive development. What happened next?
I see. Let's proceed to the next topic.
The answer to your question is as follows.

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Warmth is high - maintain if caller responds well, reduce slightly if it feels excessive.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Warmth is low - increase emotional engagement and personal acknowledgment.

parameters.name: Formality (Actual)
parameters.description: Measured formality level - vocabulary sophistication, sentence structure, register

scoringAnchors.example: I would like to elaborate on the aforementioned concept. The primary consideration involves the systematic evaluation of multiple variables.
Let me explain this concept in more detail. There are several important factors to consider here.
So here's how this works. You've got a few things to think about.
Okay so basically this is pretty straightforward - you just gotta think about a couple things.
Yeah so like, this stuff? Super easy. Just kinda figure it out, ya know?

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Formality is high - consider if caller prefers this or if it creates distance.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Formality is low - consider if caller is comfortable or if more professionalism is needed.

parameters.name: Directness (Actual)
parameters.description: Measured directness - clarity of communication, use of hedging, assertion level

scoringAnchors.example: You need to change your approach. The current method is ineffective and here's exactly what to do instead.
I'd recommend reconsidering your approach. Based on what you've shared, a different method would likely work better.
You might want to think about whether this approach is working. There could be some alternatives worth exploring.
I'm not sure, but perhaps it might be worth considering if maybe there could be other options to possibly look into.
Well, I mean, it's hard to say really, you know, everyone's different and who am I to say what might or might not work for you...

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Directness is high - effective for decisive callers, may feel pushy to others.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Directness is low - may frustrate callers seeking clear guidance.

parameters.name: Pacing (Actual)
parameters.description: Measured pacing - response length, information density, conversation tempo

scoringAnchors.example: Three key points: First, X matters because Y. Second, Z leads to W. Third, apply this by doing A, B, C. Questions?
There are a few important things to cover here. Let me walk you through the main points, and then we can discuss.
Let's take this one step at a time. First, let me explain X. Does that make sense so far?
Okay... so... let me think about how to explain this. There's this concept... and it's important because... well, let me give you an example.
Hmm. ... ... ... So. ... One thing. ... Just one thing for now.

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Pacing is fast - good for engaged callers, may overwhelm others.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Pacing is slow - good for processing, may bore quick thinkers.

parameters.name: Exploration vs Structure Balance
parameters.description: Measured balance between exploratory tangents and structured progression

scoringAnchors.example: Oh that's an interesting tangent! Let's explore that. What made you think of that connection? And that reminds me of another idea...
That's a great observation - let's spend a moment on that before we come back to our main thread.
Interesting point. We can come back to that. For now, let's continue with our current topic.
Let's stay focused on our current objective. We have specific ground to cover today.
That's off-topic. Moving on to point three of five in our agenda.

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Style is exploratory - great for high-openness callers, may frustrate structured thinkers.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Style is structured - great for conscientiousness, may feel limiting to curious callers.

parameters.name: Empathy Expression
parameters.description: Measured level of empathic response to caller emotions

scoringAnchors.example: I can really hear how frustrating that must be for you. It sounds like you've been carrying this weight for a while, and that takes a toll. Your feelings are completely valid.
That sounds really challenging. I understand why you'd feel that way given what you've been through.
I hear you. That's a difficult situation.
Okay, so given that situation, here's what I'd suggest...
Let's focus on the facts. What specifically happened?

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Empathy expression is strong - appropriate for emotional moments, may slow task progress.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Empathy expression is low - consider if caller shared emotions that need acknowledgment.

constraints.description: Style should remain relatively consistent within a single call unless deliberately shifting
Measured style should be compared against ADAPT targets to compute style alignment score
